DataElement.preferredName: Preschool HEAR-QL 8 Child is Hyperactive Score 5 Point Scale
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A parent-proxy response about whether their child is hyperactive, using a 5-point Likert scale.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Hearing Environments and Reflection on Quality of Life Parent-proxy Measure Child is Hyperactive Score
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A questionnaire designed to assess how a preschool child is affected by their hearing loss. Items are tailored to the experiences of preschool-aged children and administered as a parent-proxy (or caregiver) questionnaire._A question about whether a child was or is hyperactive._A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Hearing Environments and Reflection on Quality of Life Parent-proxy Measure
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A questionnaire designed to assess how a preschool child is affected by their hearing loss. Items are tailored to the experiences of preschool-aged children and administered as a parent-proxy (or caregiver) questionnaire.

Concepts.longName: Hearing Environments and Reflection on Quality of Life Parent-proxy
Concepts.definition: A questionnaire designed to assess how a preschool child is affected by their hearing loss. Items are tailored to the experiences of preschool-aged children and administered as a parent-proxy (or caregiver) questionnaire.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Hearing Environments And Reflection on Quality of Life 5 Point Scale
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: An ordered reference standard used to measure incremental changes from 0 (Almost Always) to 4 (Never) on a 5-point Likert scale.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

Concepts.definition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2023.8.15 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0002731. ak

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A response indicating that something happens or happened almost all of the time.

Concepts.definition: A response indicating that something happens or happened almost all of the time.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not ever; at no time in the past (or future).

Concepts.definition: Not ever; at no time in the past (or future).

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A subjective answer that something rarely happens.

Concepts.definition: A subjective answer that something rarely happens.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: From time to time, but not continually or always.

Concepts.definition: From time to time, but not continually or always.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A subjective answer that something occurs frequently.

Concepts.definition: A subjective answer that something occurs frequently.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Process and results associated with self-reported measures and instruments, surveys, other tools

Concepts.definition: An ordered reference standard used to measure incremental changes.

ValueDomain.origin: HEAR-QL:Hearing Environments And Reflection on Quality of Life Measurement for Children aged from Preschool through Adolescense;A. Umansky et al., J Am Acad Audiology

ReferenceDocuments.name: Using PRO/HRQoL Measures
ReferenceDocuments.description: This data element is part of a full set of items that comprise a PRO/HRQoL measure. The full set must be used without any changes to the questions or value set in order to retain the validity and reliability associated with the measure. Changes may not be made to these documents. In cases where retaining the question set intact to preserve the validity and reliability are not as important as advancing the science, questions may be used individually or in combination with other measure questions.
